The food was horrible. Kebabs were alright, but even my six year old can dump a bottle of teriyaki on some burnt chicken thigh. The ramen was disgusting, with sloppy mushy noodles, The cuts of chicken, in the egg soup, and "meat" in the pork ramen were questionable, as were tastes. I found a total of three hairs (not from my head) near my seat alone. 

Its a pity, the atmosphere/ambiance is so nice, I wish they would take more pride in their cooking. I hope to never ever have another experience like this again- trust in Yelp!
author: Rosemary W.

description: Just had lunch here it was pretty good. Had a ramen lunch special. Service was good. Server came by every 6 to 10 minutes to ask if everything was okay and to refill our waters. The food price was also very good.. got two lunches in under $30.00.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
shabu was very very bad. 
the soup base was just hot water.
the beef tasted like cardboard.
the Napa cabbage had a bitter taste.
servers never checked up on us.
author: Ken T.

description: Waited for more than an hour for our food and is still not here. I think the waitress was biased to other people because the people that just came already finished their food. Poor service!
author: Justin Y.

description: I ordered some chicken dish with noodles. I figured that would be safe. I'm not really a fan of Asian food. It tasted gross. The broth had a strange flavor and the chicken was even worse. Unfortunetly, Benihana was full.
author: Suzanne D.

description: The waitstaff are pleasant, so this review excludes their sincerity. The health score is 83, the paper is hidden down low behind the cash register. I wish I saw that before I ordered some sushi, but then again, I don't really know what got into my head for even thinking about ordering sushi here. This place serves run-of-the-mill Japanese dishes of which most are mediocre at best. Yes, some dishes are good, many of so/so, but the sushi was some of the worst I've ever had in my whole life. I guess it's better than the empty space that use to be here, but not by much...
author: Brian J.

description: Lunch specials here are very decently priced -- about $8 or $9 for a bowl of ramen or udon noodles. $11 for noodles with either unagi rice or California rolls. Service is a little slow but generally a good deal. Would recommend coming early or late to avoid the lines.
author: Shirley L.

description:
Cold tired and hungry, i walked into mifune bistro bc it is centrally located in japan town w signs referencing its history of making their own noodles for 90 years + a wide selection of appetizers, sushi, dons, ramen, etc.
I asked the server what i should get between the chirashi bowl n their charsiu ramen n she said definitely the latter.
Big sad face.
I've never had charsiu ramen with hard to chew/dry n harsh pork slices. 
Bland but oily ramen soup. 
Ugh i am sad for having consumed so many calories that were hard to chew n unsatisfying. 

2 stars only bc ive to sit here for another half hour til my friend gets off work to meet me.
author: daisy k.

description: Pleasantly surprised by the quality and value at Mifune Bistro. Lunch special $12.95 your choice of ramen/udon/soba + gyoza/calif rolls/curry rice. Service was good. Decor, updated/modern. All in all, well executed.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
I only come here for the Coffee & Cake special and sometimes I'll order a side of a small bowl of donburi. You get a pot of tea or coffee with a dessert of your choice and it's something different every time but I came here so many times already I know practically everything they have.

Not a fan of the regular menu though--doesn't taste authentic at all.
author: Glo D.

description:
When I first walked in (we came from the street side) I was a little confused as there was no one there to greet us. But eventually someone came out and we were seated.

We came here because I was in search of a schnitzel, however since all the German brunches were closed and we couldn't find any schnitzels, Katsu had to do.

I ordered the Katsu Curry (pork) and it hit the spot. On top of that, the portion size was pretty good. It came with a salad and miso soup along with the Katsu. Overall this restaurant wasn't bad, and I had no complaints. But it's not somewhere I would go everyday. It was a nice snack place and onto the next spot that wasn't so memorable.

I do want to mention though, inside the decor and ambiance was very relaxed and decorative.
author: Bruce K.

description:
I think this place suffers from the same mall syndrome as every other place in the building, they know as long as they seat people quick enough, they'll have customers all day long. It doesn't matter if the food is good, they just need to turn tables over. 

Food: What they lack in flavor they definitely try and make up for in portions. We ordered a chicken ramen and a curry pork katsu ramen. The chicken in the chicken ramen was a smoky and grilled, but had no seasonings whats so ever. The noodles were a little thin, not quite springy or chewy like good ramen. broth was decent. The pork katsu was the best thing, with a  good vinegary katsu sauce. The curry was watery, and far from spiced. 

Service: pretty much the only reason this place gets their stars. We were seated super quickly even though there was a wait, water was magically filled every 5 minutes, and there were plenty of waiters.  

Conclusion: If you absolutely must eat in the mall, on a Friday night, in the next fifteen minutes, you could go here. Maybe.
author: Patrick T.

description:
I'm hardly a ramen connoisseur, but I'll rate Mifune on what I know.  

Chashu Miso Ramen:
Noodles: Chewy and pleasant
Broth: Tasty, but not overly salty.  Did not leave me feeling thirsty in the hours after eating.  Also arrives without any spiciness.  Chili oil and seasonings are available on every table, so add to your own desire.
Meat: The most soft/tender slices of char sui I've ever eaten.
Bowl size: Perfect. Was large, but was still able to polish it off, albeit leaving me with a big food belly.
Price: $8.50. Pretty damn good for a Japantown establishment.

We were seated quickly, served quickly and were out of there in no time to catch a show at the Sundance Kabuki Theater right next door.  No gripes about this meal!
author: Heidi L.

description: I decided to check this place out while walking by on Sunday at 1:45, and the place was completely packed. I wanted to make sure to eat somewhere good so my boyfriend and I decided to wait in line for a table. I'm glad we did! Their service was a bit slow, but the food was very good! I will definitely be going there again.
author: Amanda J.

description: Quick service ... Very impressed at first. But after trying lunch meal  ramen soup combo, threres an unusual smell and taste . Kids never bothered to finish meal. Donburi meal is dissapointing too. You know meal is freshly made and good when they take time before you get your order. Not very satisfied and will not come back. Just an honest personal opinion and experience.
author: Ivan V.

description:
I've only eaten here twice, and NEVER AGAIN will I pay good money for shitty service and food to match.

The first time I came here with 3 friends, and we were seated right away. It wasn't too long a wait for our orders to be taken, but the wait for our food was ridiculous. Without exaggeration, I believe our wait to be near an hour for our food. Another family was seated next to us about 20 minutes after we arrived, and they received their food probably 15 minutes later. Um... seriously? Well, was the wait worth it? I guess. Or maybe I was too hungry to attempt to taste my food properly. Well, the gyoza was atrocious, anyway. We had fun chatting while waiting for our food, so the first experience wasn't horrible.

Second visit.

I came with a party of about 8 people. The same waitress that took our orders as last time was our waitress again this time. I was sitting near the end of the table while she was on the opposite side, about 2 people between me and her. She was waiting for my friend next to her to order, and since he was still undecided, my friend beside me asked if he could order. This b*****, WOW. She gave him a dirty look, then pointed at my friend who was UNDECIDED on what to order, then went back to staring at my friend. WHAT. Can you be anymore rude to a paying customer? 
I ordered niku udon. Okay, so at the expense of sounding conceited, I can whip up a niku udon that actually tastes good. Well, not to say this was BAD, but there was something a bit... off about it. I can't quite remember what it was, since this was several weeks ago, but I really don't want to go back to try. 

They separated all the checks for us, but I should've questioned mine, since it looked like it was about $3-4 more than what I ordered, but I just wanted to get the hell out of there. I really regret leaving a tip as well. I will always leave tip, even for carryout if the employee is nice, but WHY I decided to leave a tip this time was beyond me. Maybe because the lady was standing there watching me write on the receipt to see if I'd leave tip or not. Whatever, I only left her a dollar. 

I HIGHLY suggest to STAY AWAY FROM THIS RESTAURANT. There's 2 other Mifune restaurants in Japan Town. Visit either of them for even an ounce of decency from the staff. I will NEVER come back to this restaurant.
author: Katie F.

description: This place has bad customer service.  I wanted to order more drinks and food and they came to me with the check.  They then had to redo my bill and didn't even give me refills for my tea.  The place isn't even that busy or packed.  The waitresses don't even make any eye contact with the customer.
author: Ro O.

description: I'm not sure why this and the other Mifunes have generally low reviews. I think it's a solid place to get a light, tasty meal for a reasonable price. I ordered the cold soba chirashi. I love chirashi but have never seen it over anything but rice. Over soba is a genius idea! Great noodles, and the chirashi variety was great - tuna, salmon, scallop, shrimp, squid, egg, all cut pretty thin but there was definitely enough of it. There are a couple of other interesting and appetizing menu items I'd like to try next time.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Love this place. Come here randomly after hiking. Craving for some Japanese food. We had the daily special seafood ramen with CA roll. Yummyumm ^.^
author: Sharon L.

description: I've been here occasionally over the last 5 years or so. Today i was really disappointed and will not come back. The servers were not friendly and did not check on us. The rainbow roll only had 2 thin slices of tuna that were not flavorful or fresh. They forgot the shrimp tempura on the udon. When we told the server, she didn't apologize or offer anything changed the shrimp tempura was brought out but that was it. The soup was too salty too. It's too bad the service and food quality has gone down.
author: Leana L.

description: Food was alright. I got chicken katsu donburi w/ egg & onions and my boyfriend got cold soba. Nothing special. I could've made that at home... Service was slowwwww. I understand that it was busy but that's no excuse for the lack of service. Probably won't be back. There are better places to eat in Japantown
author: Lydia T.

description: Was originally going to dine at their upstairs restaurant Mifune in Japantown and saw that there was a bistro version of the restaurant on the first floor "under the bridge".  The menu had a lot of choices and the service was great. The server was very courteous and always checking on us to make sure we were pleased with the service. Had the Nabe noodles in the iron pot and the food and broth were great. Only thing I wish they had was a bit more selection on spices, sauces to add more flavor. Would definitely eat here again next time we visit Japantown
author: Richard F.

description:
Reading a few of the bad reviews I will admit the service was not that great but I'm used to bad service in Asian institutions, but ultimately food conquers the senses and that must be the most important criteria for any FOOD place.

If you could get pass the subpar service which seems like many people cannot get passed, note to them: shut up and eat, in the Asian culture we give less emphasis on service and more on taste! These people would not make it  5 minutes in a good pho place.

I ordered the beef/tempura ramen, and my GOD it made me see colors! It was served in a molten hot cauldron to insure the longevity of flavors. The broth was rich but not thick, the noodles had a nice chew, the tempura was amazing, the fish cakes sublime and the balance of vegetables was spot on. I loved the idea of a hot metal bowl because ramen changes flavors when cooled down, almost bitter so I liked that idea and wished more places did that. 

Really great place, I wish they had one in San Jose, because they would make a killing.
author: David N.

description: The plan was to go to Ramen Fest but seeing the line that wrapped around the block at 10:30, we went with plan B. After passing the food trucks, which were temping, we ended up at Mifune. Pretty good lunch combo of  miso chasu ramen with gyoza. The meal was much larger than it looked.  The ramen broth was nice and rich without being greasy and fatty. There was a lot of ramen in that small bowl. I ended up only eating one of the five pieces of gyoza since I was already stuffed.  Not bad for $12.95.
author: Heather G.

description: Okay service, bad food, okay atmosphere. Our waitress was placing our dishes on our table, and she couldn't reach my friend at the end of the table, so she asked him to take it and set it down himself. I understand that she was in a tricky position to properly set down the bowl, but we were all shocked to be asked to "take it and set it down [ourselves]." I orders the spicy tuna roll, which was okay. My friend's tempura don was all soggy without a trace of crispiness. My other friend's unagi don only had two slices of eel on it. And don't even get me started with the miso shiru..... It was SWEET and tasted like yam with a strange, dung-like aftertaste. I hate to say it, but spare yourself the trouble and please find a better place to eat!
author: Taehyun P.

description: I've eaten here several times when my favorite restaurant is closed or if I just want a quick bite to eat.  Mifune offers the cheapest ramen in Jtown.  The location is not that obvious and it is seldom crowded.  The food is ok; not awful, not great.  Most recently ordered a chicken terriyaki ramen.   The chicken was overcooked and did not have any sauce on it.  The miso broth was flavorful and had enough other "stuff" (including a hard bowled egg) in it to fill me up. Mifune is a good place for a reasonably priced Japanese meal if you are looking for a quiet and uncrowded place to eat in Jtown.  I haven't tried the sushi here.  There is no sushi counter visible and I would never eat the sushi unless I could see if made.  Do so at your own risk.
author: Martin C.

description:
-same excellent decor & service

-This was an after-Asian Film festival (There Once Was an Island) nibble:

Spicy ramen in Miso broth, the komoboko still tastes like real fish cake.
Curry Beef  Stew on ramen, no broth

YUM.

However, the new discovery on Irving Street is now in #1 position.  .  .  pork belly always wins!
author: Clifford L.

description: I scarfed down a quick dinner before a massage appointment nearby.  I scored with the special menu they have before 5PM and had the wakame udon and gyoza.  The udon noodles were so tender and fresh (I understand they make the noodles onsite), and I loved it with the seaweed.  Very comforting!  And the gyoza hit the spot, steamy, tasty good.  Thank you, Mifune, for taking my order, feeding me and bringing the bill by so quickly so I could be in and out in time for my appointment.  I will be back for a more leisurely meal soon!
author: Maile N.

description: My friend and I went to Japantown because I was craving ramen. We looked around and even yelped ramen location in the area. Eventually we settled for Mifune, I ordered ramen while my friend ordered sashimi. We had edamame because they're my favorite. Overall good service because the staff was very attentive. Food wise, I felt it was alright. I meant my ramen wasn't spectacular. My friend's sashimi was good, I didn't really get to try much of it so I can't really say.
author: Julie C.

description:
Ate here today for lunch and really, quite excellent service and good value. Portions are quite large and the food quality is good. I had the ramen lunch special with California rolls.

Environment is nice also.
author: James W.

description:
Horrible service and mediocre food. Had to ask for everything ... even to order. The people in here are not excited to be at work.

Japan town really doesnt seem to be the best place for Japanese food.
author: Jeremy R.

description: terrible food. unfresh and stringy fish. the worst excuse for a squid ink pasta i've ever had. the noodles were gray and tasted sour. the hamachi sashimi had veins running through every slice. and it was not cheap for the poor quality served. the service however, was very nice. now i know why the restaurants next door have lines out the hall and this one is rather empty. i would avoid, don't say i didn't warn you.
author: Charmaine L.

description: I got the vegetable mountain ramen here, and it was pretty good.
author: Michael E.

description: Food is below average. Service is terrible. Waitresses are not helpful, friendly, or welcoming.
author: Clarice L.

description: The food is okay. It's kind of like an average lunch place you'd go to satisfy your hunger. I would go back to try more of the food, but I've had better.
author: Jenna R.

description: I ordered an unagi donburi and I wouldn't say it was the best. It had a tinge of fishy taste to it but when I had spread the garlic all over it eliminated the fishy taste. As for service, I couldn't really complain as we were the only ones eating in the restaurant. All in all I gave this place a 3 stars. Not that bad of a place to dine in.
author: Rajee S.

description:
***DECENT JAPANESE RESTAURANT, NOTHING SPECIAL***

I have been here for business lunch meetings and I have not been impressed.  I was disappointed the first time and I thought if I came back a second time things may be different but I was wrong. 

The green tea is water down and flavorless.  The sunomono is supposed to be a mix of seaweed and octopus.  I could count the pieces of octopus in the sunomono on one hand. 

I have not had any rolls but I have tried the various nigiri pieces.  The fish is of average to slightly above average quality, and the cut is not generous by any standard. 

Also, and this is mind boggling: Mifune does NOT validate parking for the garage which is underneath the Japantown Mall where this restaurant is found.  

I would not recommend this restaurant.  If you can settle for a quick snack, go one block over on Post to Nijiya Market and grab some pre-made food.  If you want a hot, fresh meal, head upstairs in the Japantown Mall and go to the restaurant located on the bridge.
author: Ravi M.

description:
Pretty good meal here, above average.
The soba was good which they are known for. 
The salmon terriyaki was a very small portion for the price they were asking.
I will come back as JapanTown doesn't have any restaurants greater than 3 stars except for Dosa which is 4-5 stars.
author: M E.

description:
When the main Mifune restaurant is packed with a line out the door, come to this one.  I've been here twice, and never had to wait.  They have a nice lunch combo.  The udon is quite good, and I ordered it with a mini chirashi.  My main complaint is that I have never had a piece of sashimi that has been sliced so paper thin before.  I suppose you get what you pay for, but it would have been nice if the sashimi had a little more substance to it.

Overall, seems like a good place for a light afternoon snack.
author: Jimmy W.

description: It's a bit overcast in San Fran today. And there's a street fair here in Japantown. Wife and I weren't turned on by the street vendors so we stopped in here to Mifune bistro. Glad we did. Lunch special $13 each with more food than we can handle. And it's so delicious. Soup and a choice of a side. So so sooooo yummy. Love every minute. We will be back. In fact... I can't wait to come back here!
author: Ralph A.

description:
It was just OK. The food was decent but nothing great. 

The waitresses were not very happy or helpful. The price of the lunch special was reasonable but the food is forgettable.
author: Amy L.

description:
tl;dr: good food, good value and good portions, but terrible service makes it not worthwhile.

Came for lunch on a crowded Saturday in Japantown.  We came here because there was no wait, and the food looked reasonable enough.  

Overall, the food was pretty good, with a fair price and sizable portions.  I liked the chicken teriyaki ramen here - the teriyaki flavor was a good combo with the rest of the ramen flavor.  

Service was awful, though.  It was impossible to flag a server in the back corner where we were sitting.  One of my lunchmates physically got up to get a server to take our order.  They were even quite slow serving us our one drink (which was a Coke out of a can!).  Then, at the end, gratuity was already included for our party of five.  That seems like a fairly small group to get pre-included gratuity. 

Wouldn't recommend solely because of the service.
author: S L.

description:
OK, the breakdown is 2 stars for the food, but an extra star for the service and ambiance. It is serene and easy to get a table. The service is prompt and courteous.

I can always count on being able to get a table and basic food quickly and efficiently. However, there just isn't anything that special about their food. There is something missing in the soup broths--can't quite figure it out. Maybe not enough soy sauce, or the dashi is a bit thin? The noodles are clearly packaged, the same kind of stuff I throw together at home. If you want handmade noodles, go to Sanuki on the other side of the mall. The ramen and croquettes are passable, but there are plenty of places that do it better for the same price or less.

I like the greens salad served as a side to various dishes, though. Other details like the side dish of pickles was odd--julienned namasu (carrot and fresh daikon radish pickles) was mixed with julienned takuan (the yellow radish pickles), the water used to brew the tea was too hot so the tea ended up a bit bitter.

I can say that this Mifune is better than the one upstairs.
author: 和子

description:
Very happy with every experience I have here. Nice quiet setting and good decor. Servers are all very gracious and give you plenty of time to decide and privacy, but also just attentive enough.

I usually come here for ramen. I get the vegetable ramen. Fresh veggies and noodles, and a broth to thoroughly enjoy!! One of my favorite places because of the broth. Wish they had thinner noodles, but that's alright. A great amount is provided too. A lot, but if you have time, worth finishing.
Friends I've gone with said the meat dishes and sushi is fairly good too! The plating here is so pretty and elegant for a simpler place. Everyone here is nice, be sure to ask questions, they will help!
There's also a separate section that's a bar, more lounge-y I suppose. Wait is never too long. Get a pitcher here! Decent beer, light and will definitely help with spicy ramen. (:

Kitchen closes at 9:30, servers are very nice at making sure you get a chance to order enough food before then.
They also have shabu-shabu, which I haven't tried yet.

Overall just a nice place to eat some ramen. See a movie at Kabuki close by, or look through the Japanese bookstores and stationary stores in the building.
author: Sophie C.

description: Ordered a chicken katsu curry and found chunks of beef in it?  Just found it a little strange, since it's supposed to be chicken.  The curry was decent, but the service here was almost non-existent.  They didn't refill our water cups, and I actually had to get up to ask someone for tea. They also didn't clear out any of the plates so the table was really crowded and messy.  We actually walked by the restaurant 30 minutes after we had left, and the table still wasn't cleared.  I guess there's a reason why this place was empty compared to the rest of the restaurants in Japantown.
author: Tina L.

description: Food was just ok. Oyako Don was reasonable. The Miso soup was a downer - one of the worst I've had. Wouldn't go there again.
author: Anwar H.

description:
Walking around Japantown, we saw a sign for all you can eat shabu shabu, which our group totally is in love with.  We decided to go there, and fill our bellies with tons of meat (and some veggies too).  It was a lot of fun, we all miss the shabu shabu in Japan, but this sufficed for the time being.  We got all you can eat beef, all kinds of veggies, rice, and edamame.  Awesome.

It was pretty decent, especially for only $25 a person.  I really liked how many other little things they gave you besides the beef and basic veggies.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Jenna L.

description:
I've probably been to Mifune Bistro nine or ten times in the last year, and I like it. The food I order is usually pretty good (not the best I've ever had, but it's solid). 

I usually order the same things -- ramen (spicy or miso), katsu curry, gyoza, or hiyayakko tofu. My favorite is the hiyayakko tofu. You get four cubes of cold tofu, two with chopped tuna and tomatoes and two with shiso paste and seaweed. 

I don't like the miso soup (they put carrot in it and it's kind of weirdly sweet) or the seaweed salad (too slimy). 

I've never had to wait for a table, there are partitions so you have plenty of space, and it's a large restaurant so it's good for groups. When friends come to visit me at work (I work in Japantown), I usually bring them here for lunch or dinner.
author: Annie K.

description: First time here and was seated right away. Had their lunch special for $11.25 which came with a side that was Niku Don with my Chashu Ramen. My ramen was pretty typical, the egg had no flavor but was still filling. My sister had their beef shabu for lunch for $14.95 and it was basically an udon bowl with the beef already inside, which kinda ruins the fun of shabu where you cook it yourself. The soup base was really plain and my sister wasn't happy with it. If we were to ever come back, we will try something else but the ramen and beef shabu is a no for us. Otherwise, the staff is attentive and the restaurant is very spacious with our own booths, but the food isn't anything too special.
author: Amanda C.

description: Too expensive. For an example: The bento box is like $21.00. I'm used to it being like $15-16 elsewhere.  The waiter/waitresses didn't come often to collect empty/dirty plates.  The food was good, but still not a place I will come back to.
author: Jocelyn C.

description: Don't do the shabu here, they're not experienced at all! PROs: good sauces, good meat and fresh enough veggies. CONs: slow service, no flavored soup base, pot never boils, you offer ponzu sauce but you don't have garlic, cilantro etc. Mifune, you're like giving a feening person a cigarette but then you turn around and tell me there's no lighter
author: G L.

description: Try to find an affordable, good japanese resturant in japan town.  Then we came across mifune bistro.  Service was average.  No real, greeting or suggestions on food selection.  We had katsu donburi, sukiyaki, and seafood ramen.  Very fast service which scored a lot of points.  So after we dug in, the sukiyaki and ramen were very good and tasty.  The katsu was good but not great.  The miso that came with the katsu was below average.  Over all it was very good but could improve on the service.
author: Gregg P.

description: I've tried all the mifune restaurants in Japantown and they're pretty descent. But this one, wasn't as good. The food just taste weird or different. Sure, it looks nice and fancier than the other mifune's. But the food isn't as good and the service. You have to pay for tea and worst part was the waitress offered us tea at the end, when we asked for the bill. I was really thirsty, I don't know, maybe they do charge for water as well...
author: M L.

description: I love this place, I mixed up with the spicy beef steak ramen, so good! Resturant was nice and clean, customer service was good. Will have to come back again.
author: Jerry G.

description: I was starving and was in need of food. It was past 3 and I happened to be in Japantown and saw this place. Thinking it would be like the other Mifune I walk in and ordered a bowl of what looked like seafood ramen and a plate of gyoza. The gyoza were to die for. Tasty and juicy and full of flavor! The bowl of ramen, not sooo much... The noodles were fine but the broth was swimming in MSG. The fish pieces were broken up. The squid was over cooked and rubbery. The shrimp were chewy. But I was really hungry so I took care of that bowl and finished it. Not sure if I want to come back. Maybe I should come back at an earlier time. Not sure...
author: Anthony L.

description: stomer service was trashy. Come with 8 friends and had to wait a while to order. The waitress was pushy and impatient. Then we only get 3 cups of water and then they completely ignore us. Then they proceed and give us only 4 tiny cups of water. WHAT KIND OF A RESTAURANT RUNS OUT OF WATER CUPS?!?!! They don't even give spoons for miso soup, and to add onto that they tried to give us the wrong order. Clearly they have no organization. All in all, the food was okay, but the service was really trashy and disappointing.
author: Vincent T.

description: This place is pretty good! The lunch special they have is pretty decent. Isn't that expensive. You get a choice of what you want and there's a lot of variety. The customer service is pretty good. They are polite and well-coming. The restaurant itself is pretty quiet and calm creating a peaceful atmosphere which is pretty good since the time people eat should be relaxing and calm. The decorations are unique and someone elegant.
author: Stella L.

description: Average. Had a bowl of udon and an order of kaarage chicken. Neither were horrible, but neither were great.
author: Brandon L.

description: It's really just an average joe when it come to Japanese food. There could be better, there could be worse. I got the tempura don with came with vegetable tempura and two shrimp tempuras. I noticed that the tempura was not crispy and was actually quite soggy when I got it. And no, it's because I was on my phone. I always fidget with my phone after food! I tried it anyway and yes, definitely not crispy and wasn't the texture I like my tempura to be but the taste wasn't bad at all. It wasn't great either. My mom got the niku soba so we traded plates after eating half and I must say, I was very dissappointed at the niku soba. The noodles were overcooked and the taste of the broth was very bland. I wouldn't recommend eating here unless you have to but that's just me being that I'm a huge Japanese foodie and my family is Japanese. If you know of anywhere better, go there instead, we tried it because we were on vacation.
author: Phillip K.

description: Horrible. I ordered the chirashi and it was awful. One of the sashimi tasted all weird and slimy. It was disgusting. Never coming back here again. Plus, service was horrible.
author: Jonathan J.

description:
We selected this particular restaurant at random. When you're walking down the hallway the restaurants don't really distinguish themselves too much. We knew we didn't want Benihana because we can get decent Japanese steak house at home. 

We weren't terribly disappointed, but the food didn't have a wow factor either. I will say that the service was fast and courteous. We don't live near any kind of ethnic restaurants whatsoever, so our experience with certain types of foods is somewhat limited. We had shabu once before in NYC where we prepared our own. Our 10yo was looking forward to having it again, specifically making it. However, she was disappointed when they brought it out fully prepared. It was flavorful, but again, not particularly exciting. 

Overall, not a horrible decision, but not anything that leaves me thinking "I have to get back there."
author: pathic d.

description:
I agree with a previous review, it's decent, but nothing special. You can find some cheap items which is great. I've been here twice and have ordered-

-beef curry rice, i'm not too picky and it tasted good to me, a smoother consistency than some of the other curry's in the mall. I would order again.

-lunch special chasu ramen+niku don $10.90- the ramen was bland, and i'm not too hard to please, but it was bland, the niku don was a small side, and was ok too.

Boyfriend has ordered the -curry udon good, but small portion, i believe it was $8.50..

Service during the week-night was fine, but when we went on new years day it was packed, and it was not so great.

I'll probably go again, and will stick to a week night!
author: vanessa g.

description: We had the Chicken Katsu with Curry Rice. Both items were so bland if I closed my eyes I seriously wouldn't know what I ordered. Chicken/Pork/Beef? The curry could've been oatmeal for all I know. Just too top it off at the end when our bill came, I noticed the servers added a tip percent onto my total bill. It was hand-written to the total but that annoyed me even more since we waited so long to place our order. The table next to us got served before we did but we sat down earlier. For the price of the food the quality of service does not match. There is no "Bistro" factor at this location. Better to go to either of the other two places.
author: A M.

description: This service here was very nice. I didn't like something and I told waitress and they were willing to change something else for me!! Thank you :)
author: Pat P.

description: We had noodles and teriyaki chicken with rice.  Ehhhhh, nothing special at all and you can definitely get the same quality of food elsewhere for a cheaper price.  I suggest going to another restaurant instead of this one.
author: Sw H.

description:
The food was decent. The service was minimal. What made me give a one-star review was when the check came. My friends and I ordered food coming to about thirty something dollars. We expected to pay our individual checks and didn't mind very much when only one check came. But then we saw final total of $43. Allow me to explain. They charged us $5 for gratuity (which I think should've been up for the customer to decide because I don't think that we should have had to give $5 for someone to bring over my food and refill my cup once.) Now here's the thing that pisses the hell off. So the $5 tip was ADDED to the total. AND THEN COMES THE TAX. THEY TAXED THE TIP. THE HELL. WHY ARE YOU TAXING THE TIP. THAT MAKES NO DAMN SENSE. Okay, so you're a restaurant restaurant and I've been to plenty of those. NONE OF THEM TAX MY TIP. WHY ARE YOU DOING THAT. YOU ARE CHEATING ME OF MY MONEY. WHAT EVEN. I'm never coming here again.

Also, there is no bathroom in the restaurant itself. You have to exit the restaurant, take a right, and use the public bathroom around the corner. This saddened me greatly.
author: Cara C.

description: the food was fucking nasty, i normally dont write bad reviews but wen i do im going to be blunt. the food tasted old, nasty, not fresh, and like shit. this restaurant is a wasted space. they either need a food makeover or close down for heaven sakes. the best mifune is the one on the east plaza lol even the one inside the west plaza is ok... yeah this is the worst one
author: Linda A.

description: The Tempera Udon I order was good and so were the fried octopus. The salmon was a little overcooked and dry to the taste for Salmon Teriyaki my sister ordered. They served cold water instead of hot tea unless ordered. For the Tempera Udon, the sauce does not come with the tempera unless asked for unlike the other stores. Price is rather decent tho. waiter disappears a lot and took some time to get to our table which is four tables from the door. There was only about 10 people not including my sister and I.
author: Angel H.
